description: Onomatopoeic of the sound made by a bird. Compare twitter. The social media senses evolved from earlier Twitter update, twit (noun), twitter (verb).

entries.meaning: The sound of a bird; any short high-pitched sound or whistle.
examples: [Ignatz, dropping Officer Pupp's police whistle into the lake:] The fishes will have lots of fun tweeting tweets on it.

entries.meaning: (social media) An entry posted on the microblogging service Twitter. [from 2007]
examples: For example, as you edit a tweet in Twitter, the number of characters left is updated as you type.

verbs.description: tweet (third-person singular simple present tweets, present participle tweeting, simple past tweeted or (Internet, rare, humorous) twote, past participle tweeted or (Internet, rare, humorous) twoten)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To make a short high-pitched sound, like that of certain birds.
examples: [Ignatz, dropping Officer Pupp's police whistle into the lake:] The fishes will have lots of fun tweeting tweets on it.

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive, social media) To post an update to Twitter. [from 2007]
